reviews.review_msg: Most unprofessional prof in my 6 years at SFU. Rude with students/TA, spent one hour arguing about midterm grades with the class during lecture. Released grades after WD. Office hours were during one of the tutorials. Project outline was impossible to follow, strict formatting. Most the class went to the chair, nothing was done. Avoid at all costs.

I've never had a more negative experience with a professor at SFU. Stunning lack of respect for students and TA, no clarity on project outlines and exam expectaions, and was even 10 min late for the final. Avoid at all cost, the kin dept. isn't getting rid of him any time soon. Course content isn't hard, but he makes it feel like climbing Everest.

This is the worst professor I have ever had in all my years at SFU. I cannot even begin to explain how frustrated I am with BPK 312. This is a very poorly laid out course with the most disorganized and jumbled slides that are extremely LONG and boring. There is an INSANE amount of irrelevant info that you're expected to know! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

Most unorganized prof I've had all 4 years at SFU. Battled with TA entire semester. Remarked all midterms after TA had finished marking & most students lost grades. TA left for 3 weeks (& I don't blame her) cause she was so fed up with him so he tried to run tutorials himself 
Anyway, didn't give him 1/5 cause he brought snacks for the last class

There are so many unnecessary projects and assignments in this class as well as extremely long lectures that have unlimited amounts of typos and are repetitive. Don't bother going to class since when he just READS off the slides he READS WRONG and confuses not only himself but everyone sitting there. Seems like his teaching days are behind him...

Dr. White was the worst professor I have had in my 3 years at SFU so far. His lecture slides were jam packed with info, to the point it took 10 min to understand a single slide, with lots of typos and useless info. He would just read off lecture slides during lecture, and was condescending when speaking to students. Huge miscommunications with TA.

Would recommend to avoid if possible. His slides are some of the worst I've seen in my 5 years at SFU (he does not event take the time to read them over; tons of spelling errors and things stated multiple times). Additionally, he has not bothered marking anything that occurred in the last 1.5 months. TA was the only reason this course was worked.

Wouldn't recommend this professor to any fellow students, by far one of the most boring lecturers ever in my academic life. I am not the only one, all my friends agreed that he literally went off the slides words by words, without expanding any useful material possible. Super disorganized, needed to send him several emails to get a reply

One of the worst professors that I have ever had. His lectures are old and are literally copied and pasted from the course textbook - verbatim. He reads off his lectures with no elaboration on any of the topics. His exam questions are poorly written and most often results in wrong answers, not because the topic is hard, but the ?s don't make sense
avoid.

Do not take BPK 110 w/ Matt. His slides are like as if they were written decades ago, he uses a lot of acronyms that drive you CRAZY, he reads off his slides mainly; no point in going to lecture, he does not use Canvas and uses his own websites instead, TAs were not good; didn't know much about course

Midterm and final questions were hard. Material on tests is harder than textbook and lectures. I wouldn't recommend taking it unless it's absolutely necessary. Matt just reads off the slides for the whole two hours in lectures and tutorials were useless (no discussion of class materials most of the time)
He expects us to memorize hours of him reading off of slide verbatim. Brutal professor.

BORING LECTURES, He reads his lectures for 2 hours straight. Mid term and Final require extreme memorization. Also the tests seemed to focus heavily on concepts that were not stressed in lectures at all. Wouldn't recommend unless you need to take his class.

Matthew should be ashamed of himself for not teaching textbook materials. He makes the hardest test which lead to AVG of 64. Slides are dry and useless for test. He is unwilling to answer student's questions and often late for lecture. Be prepare to teach yourself/memorized details/ do presentations

The presentation slides were blue and yellow wish made it hard to focus, he just read off the slides and would barely give extra information. He would post the slides on a website but doesn't use canvas. There is tutorial work that is mandatory to complete, there is also a presentation by the end of the semester too.
he just read out what's on his slides.

Nicest prof ever! He brought us timbits and coffee to class, how sweet! Plays jeopardy games with the class to give you a chance to boost your grade. Would definitely take another one of his classes! Thanks Matt :)

Matt is a super nice guy who will bend over backwards to help you. However, he has difficultly explaining relatively simple concepts and didn't seem to be able to answer straight-forward questions about discrepancies in lecture slides or whatever. will need patience to work out what he thinks is important. Debates are a LOT of work but graded fair

he seems to be a nice guy but he's so boring when he's lecturing, he tries though but he's so confusing and fast paced that he doesn't make anything clear. he basically repeats his slides. his exams are hard but still doable, his marking scheme is very detailed though and the group projects are totally killer since he marks so hard.

Super great prof. Very straightforward, and all the content you need to know is in his lecture slides. You use the textbook for assignmentsfurther clarification and studying. It isn't mandatory. CONTENT-HEAVY course. Exams are clear and easy if you study enough. Assignments are also straightforward. An easy AB class. Funny and passionate.

Amazing Prof. Need to memorize quite a bit of stuff but other wise his testes are fair and he grades fairly too. No surprises. Just read his lecture notes, don't even bother with the textbook except for the assignments.
Need to memorize lots of stuff in this course. Have to be familiar with all the functions of vitamin and how they work in bodies.
GREAT teacher and great notes! very clear on what to be tested. easy to understand and easy to reach. Readings are very important Want to take his class again.
Matthew is AWESOME! Very interesting and democratic. He gives great examples to clarify the concept in the course.
he is fun~you cant image how detail his lecture notes are. exam is fair, if you study, you get it, if no, well~ ~~
Matthew is very thoughtful and LOVES kinesiology!! Everything he does is for his students and makes lecture really fun! He is an awesome prof who really cares about his students and his work!
This class was wicked. Played "who wants to be a nutritionist" and gives you 1% to final grade. I took it summer of 2009. Wicked guy, wicked class.

HES SUCH AN AWESOME PROF! he tries to make nutrition fun with his games and jokes - and it works! he gives great notes and tries to make the 6 classes of nutrients exciting considering the amount of crap that is. would take another class with him, you must study hard but it pays off.
Very thoughtful prof, made sure material was understandable and clear. Textbook reading may be needed for some sections as the class was intersession and a lot of material is covered each class.

He really is a great guy and a great prof. He is obviously very enthusiastic about the course and he tries his best to make the class interactive and to accommodate people's suggestions. I would definitely take another class with him.

awesome prof!! he started the game "who wants to be a physiologist" to encourage kids to come to class. this is the first semester i've NEVER missed a single lecture...and i've done about 10% higher than my avg grade (just by even coming to class). yeah he will stumble in late sometimes, but c'mon it's 9:30 AM! He just really likes DETAILS!

Most useless frustrating prof in the entire history of profs. His slides are wrong all the time, he's always late and unorganized, and if you ask him a question he will never know the answer, but he may try to make something up so be careful. I think it was a joke for everyone in the class, it almost amused us.

Most rediculous prof ever! I don't know how many lecture slides and midterm questions had errors in them. He is so unorganized and cannot convey lecture material so that it can be understood. He should stick entirely to research. To get a good grade you MUST read the textbook as his notes don't make sense.

this prof is the worst and the most irresponsible prof I have ever had. He does not know what he is teaching. I don't know where he got his PhD degree from. I wish the university will kick him out of the school soon.
No Comments

Great person. Horrible teacher. We would constantly have to correct him on what he said or wrote in class. He can't explain himself out of a box. Every lecture seemed rushed and muddled. The textbook was more helpful. Avoid Dr.White and try and take KIN305 w/Dr.Walsh (who was a guest lec while Dr.White was away...thank goodness).

He's never sure of what he's saying and there are TONS of mistakes in his notes all the time.  I've never met someone else so scattered. how does he get dressed in the morning.  aside from that, he's a good guy and tries hard to help.  But his notes suck cause they are so convoluted and too point form. reading textbook is a must.

really nice prof....very geeky when it comes to nutrition...tries to make some jokes and lighten things up (bad joker :P) this was an intersession course, very rapid if you're not good at memorizing, this course will be somehwat of a challenge. very good content! his midterm was fair, his final was ridiculously hard. too many small details
he's a good guy
No Comments

Funny guy, good lecturer...first midterm and final were fair, second midterm was unfairly difficult...don't take this course if you think it's an easy science option, cause it ain't!!  too much of everthing, but very informative...
